Description: Rim fragment of Attic pottery band-cup; outside, rim black glazed, dipinto with potter's signature on reserved body below; inside black-glazed with reserved thin band at lip.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Leiden University, Faculty of Archaeology. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For further discussion see A. Johnston, 'Notes on Naukratis in the Netherlands', ZPE 198 (2016) 110-1.
Bibliographic references: Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 233 no. 1) (wrongly listed as Amsterdam)
van de Wiel 1968 / Verzameling ceramiek en Terracotta's Archaeologisch Instituut der Rijksuniversiteit Leiden (p. 10, N 31, pl. 2, N 31)
Prins de Jong 1925 / Scherben aus Naukratis: Aus der Sammlung des Universitäts-Professors Dr Fr W Freih von Bissing (p. 60-1, no. 15)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1568)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: T.2947 (Musée Scheurleer (The Hague) Registration number)
